p: A sequence dissimilarity distance of 0.015 was used to cluster sequences into operational taxonomic units (OTUs), using the average neighbor algorithm. Taxonomies were assigned using the HOMD reference dataset. The richness of communities was calculated using the Chao1 and Catchall indices [ 30, 31] and diversity was estimated with the Simpson’s inverse [ 32] and Shannon [ 33] indices. Good’s non-parametric estimator was used to assess the coverage of communities in samples [ 34]. The species diversity was examined by analyzing the beta diversity. Samples were adjusted to 2997 reads per sample by random sampling. Distance matrices were generated with the Jaccard Index and the thetaYC measure of dissimilarity [ 35], and by principal coordinate analysis (PCoA). Dendrograms, representing the relationships between samples, were analyzed by parsimony and UniFrac [ 36].
